Places On My Bucket List

I haven't really been outside the U.S., (unless you count Niagra Falls when I was 11). But I have a passport and I'm not afraid to use it. Here are some of the places I'd love to go.

  • Ireland
  • Germany
  • Spain

  • Italy

  • Norway

  • Greece

  • Thailand

California

My time in California was part of a month long trip where we went to the different state parks and major cities in California. This trip included Joshua Tree, Yosemite, The Channel Islands, Muir Woods, Death Valley, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and quite a few more. One of the longer and more in-depth trips I've taken so far. Definately my favorite trip. I had tons of fun and absolutely loved it.

Iowa

Iowa is my home state! I grew up in the city of Dubuque and have ventured to the mojority of the state by now. Some of the more natury trips I've taken include Dunning Springs in Decorah, Pike's Peak State Park in McGregor, and Maquoteka Caves State Park in Maquoketa.

Florida

Went in the summer. It was very humid but luckily we had air-conditioning. We also made a trip to Universal Studios in Orlando and hit all the rides we could, especially the Harry Potter ones! Big fan. And hit up the beach, of course.

Illinois

Chicago, new home

Kentucky

While in Kentucky, I visited Mammoth Cave National Park. It had some pretty cool trails and waterfalls in addition to the awesome caves. I remember it being a very warm day and then walking down into the caves felt like i was walking into a very cold, air-conditioned room. The whole experience was great. Highly recommend.

Minnesota

Spent a long weekend in Minneapolis. What made this trip stand out was the combination of some good food and hitting some quality nature spots as well as just exploring somewhere I had never been before.

North Carolina

North Carolina was a lot of fun. We went to Jockey's Ridge State Park in Nag's Head. There were a bunch of giant sand dunes where there were people flying all kinds of kites, big, small, fancy, and humble. Pictured, is me flying our humble little kite. Also, one of the most memerable sunsets I've seen was there as well. Pictures don't do it justice, of course, but I was able to capture one right before the sun hit the horizon.

Navada

This trip was actually part of the long California trip but I felt it deserved its own highlight. We went to the Luxor Hotel and Casino in Vegas and, honestly, the best part was the endless mimosas and buffet. We also made our way to Lake Mead, went for a swim and then Hoover Dam which was pretty neat.

Tennessee

In Tennessee, we made our way to Nashville, of course. Couldn't stay long, but we were able to enjoy some surprisingly good seafood. Good enough to earn a mention in my travel blurp. We were on our way to the Smoky Mountains. There, we found some pretty cool waterfalls and lots and lots of trails. Made it to the highest point of the mountains, Clingmans Dome. Absolutely loved my experience there. Saw bears, snakes, and plenty of other wildlife so it's safe to say we got our fill of nature while we were there.

Virginia

Who doesn't love a trip to Virginia Beach? Great first time touching the Atlantic Ocean. We also went to Chincoteague Island which was pretty cool. There was an island of just horses and we happened to arrive there just as a festival was taking place celebrating the island of ponies.

Wisconsin

Been to a lot of places in Wisconsin. Some of the best spots I've been to include Devil's Lake, Wyalusing State Park, Wisconsin Dells, Madison, and the world's largest "M" in Platteville.
